title: Scene 3: Force Feeding
text:
You aren’t hungry. You haven’t been since the screaming started. The food is cold, the room is fluorescent, and your paper gown feels like it’s trying to peel your skin off.

You tell them, gently, 'No thank you.' You slide the plate forward untouched. You’re polite. Respectful. It doesn’t matter.

A staff member—built like a prison guard, bald and brimming with something unprocessed—grabs you.

He throws you down. Knees to your chest. Arm across your throat. He holds your nose shut until your mouth opens to breathe.

Then he crams eggs—rubbery, lukewarm, tasting of metal and salt—into your mouth with his bare hand.

'You’ll eat,' he says. 'Or you’ll choke.'

You swallow, sobbing.

Later they call it a 'nutritional intervention.' Your chart notes 'non-compliance with meal plan.'

choices.text: Go limp. Escape into your mind.
choices.result: They call you 'quiet and cooperative' in the next shift handoff.

choices.text: Ask to file a grievance with the patient advocate.
choices.result: You're told, 'He’s been here for years. You won’t win this one.'

choices.text: Scream. Tell them this is abuse.
choices.result: Security is called. Again. Sedation follows.
